Job Title: Business Development Manager, Facial, Allergan Aesthetics, Colorado Springs, CO
Job Description:
Job Description

The Business Development Manager will support the injectables; Botox, Juvéderm and Kybella

Description -

Allergan plc (NYSE: AGN) is a bold, global pharmaceutical company and a leader in a new industry model - Growth Pharma. Allergan is focused on developing, manufacturing and commercializing branded pharmaceutical, device, biologic, surgical and regenerative medicine products for patients around the world.

Allergan markets a portfolio of leading brands and best-in-class products for the central nervous system, eye care, medical aesthetics and dermatology, gastroenterology, women's health, urology and anti-infective therapeutic categories. With commercial operations in approximately 100 countries, Allergan is committed to working with physicians, healthcare providers and patients to deliver innovative and meaningful treatments that help people around the world live longer, healthier lives every day.

Allergan is a company that will inspire you to aim high with your ambition. Where you can build bridges all over the world. Where you can power ideas that drive change. And where you will act fast and drive results for customers and patients.  Power your future & join our bold team.

Position Overview:

Business Development Manager represents the Facial Aesthetics product portfolio to targeted aesthetic customers within a designated geographical area. Responsible for creating product acceptance and enhancing portfolio growth through business development activities. The BDM provides technical product and procedure expertise as well as competitive product differentiation. Assigned sales goals are obtained through creative, consultative selling and implementation of the U.S. Sales/Marketing plan. The company offers flexible career paths with a strong emphasis on opportunity for internal mobility.

Main Areas of Responsibilities

The Business Development Manager (BDM) leverages Allergan Medical resources to enhance adoption of the Facial Aesthetics Portfolio. Synergistically works and coordinates activities with other Allergan sales personnel and support teams (include, but are not limited to, facial aesthetics, breast aesthetic, APCs, neurology, topical aesthetics, medical dermatology, marketing, and other Allergan sales forces). Complies with required reports, requests, and compliance policies. Effectively manages field assets and resources to include, but not limited to, expense management, computer and other allocated equipment.

#LI-AA


Qualifications

Education and Experience:

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher required

Requirements:

  • 3 to 5 years successful medical sales/practice management experience
  • 7 to 10 years business experience
  • Experience and knowledge of general marketing principles and concepts within the healthcare environment
  • Experience and knowledge of inner workings of a physicians practice
  • Valid driver’s license

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

  • Analytical skills
  • Strong business acumen
  • Proven selling skills
  • Strong and effective consultative skills
  • Strong conflict and problem resolution skills
  • Ability to develop key strategies and execute
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong contract/negotiating skills
  • Financial/budgetary experience
  • Ability to travel
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs.
  • Proficiency on excel, word, power point and other software skills

Job Title: Associate Director, Strategic Communications - Anterior Segment/Ophthalmology
Job Description:
Job Description

This position leads the development and implementation of the Strategic Marketing Communications for the US Anterior Segment Ophthalmology business through External Expert (EE) Identification and Development, advisory feedback activities and non-personal promotion opportunities.  This position will build relationships with External Experts and interact with national and regional societies and organizations to gain insight into the market and competition. Oversees key customer relationships, including development of advisors, consultants, and customers. Responsible for supporting marketing communications for the Dry Eye, Presbyopia and launch products within the Anterior Segment.

As a member of the marketing team, this individual will align with US brand strategy and collaborate with Sales and Marketing stakeholders in both the management and development of EEs, advisors, and consultants.  Responsible for communicating key strategies and messages to sales organization, while working closely with sales & marketing to identify and cultivate key accounts and thought leaders.

This individual develops and implements promotional education through working collaboratively with Executive Director on speaker identification and speaker training.  Provides content feedback for peer-to-peer initiatives and promotional programs.

Maintains responsibility for: identifying agency and vendor collaborative opportunities; management of agency and vendor relationships to deliver upon content output; meeting deadlines and budget adherence.

Ensures adherence to legal guidelines with all medical education, scientific literature and other tools to educate physician community. Effectively maintains budgets and maintains financial accountability.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • EE/Key Customer Development - Leads the development and implementation of the Strategic Marketing Functions for the US Anterior Segment business unit through External Expert Identification and Development, advisory feedback activities and non-personal promotion opportunities.  Aligns with US brand strategy and collaborate with Sales and Marketing stakeholders in both the management and development of EEs, advisors, and consultants.  Directs and coordinates activities to ensure achievement of company objectives as well as resolve problems; work with other departments to accomplish the same.
  • Market/Competitive Insights and Coordination at Major Meetings - Responsible for Strategic Communications Activities at major Ophthalmology meetings including sponsorship negotiation and execution, peer to peer education, advisory feedback, and EE engagement and advocacy. Coordinates interaction with Senior Management for EEs and key market influencers.  Coordinates all planning and organization with cross-functional peers during comprehensive OPH meetings (HE, ASCRS, WIO, AAO) with a focus on the Anterior Segment portfolio and ensuring alignment and execution across the entire care portfolio engagement plan.
  • Financial/Business Acumen - Develop, analyze and monitor Strategic Communications budgets and expenses. Identifies changes in market conditions, which would lead to favorable/unfavorable variance to budget/forecast.  Identifies opportunities for incremental spend to drive brand growth.  Maintains adherence to budget and conducts quarterly variance analysis.

ONGOING RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Works closely with the broader Commercial team to ensure alignment with evolving brand needs and strategic and tactical plans.
  • Oversees development and execution of Anterior Segment Consulting AOP by working with appropriate CCG and agency personnel.
  • Execute conference strategy to include negotiation, internal systems processing, collaboration with internal stakeholders, and execution of all sponsorship deliverables and marketing strategies
  • Collaborates cross functionally with Eye Care Marketing team, IBTs, Sales Training, Medical Affairs, Legal, Compliance, and Specialty Rx Sales Team Leadership.
  • Develop and execute customer-facing strategic initiatives, including identifying HCP partnership opportunities, building EE engagement plans and managing advisory boards.
  • Attends key industry meetings and stays abreast of Portfolio science via medical and scientific literature, scientific meetings, and symposia.
  • Takes ownership of HCP consultant engagement and National, Regional, and Promotional speaker symposia by identifying appropriate speakers for speaker engagements such as Product Theaters, unbranded speaking opportunities etc.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) required, in related field, from four-year College or university
  • 10 years’ experience in Eye Care or Health Care industry
  • 2 years health care field sales management experience preferred
  • Previous Strategic Communications or KOL relationship management experience preferred
  • Experience with agency and vendor management

Essential Skills, Experience, and Competencies (includes Licenses, Credentials)

  • 5+ years of project management skills with the ability to work in a matrixed organization
  • Ability to travel, a minimum of 60%, including some weekends.
  • Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and SharePoint.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing, with many levels of employees of various disciplines within various departments and all other internal and external contacts.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and prioritization skills and ability to balance multiple priorities.
  • Demonstrated experience in presenting to and engaging with Senior Executives
  • Demonstrated effective presentation skills – including podium presence
  • Must be a self-directed individual that acts as a team player
  • Superior analytical and forward-thinking skills
  • Ability to drive a car and possess a valid and current driver’s license

Additional Information

  • The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.​

Job Title: Manager, Business and Digital Analytics - Immunology
Job Description:
Job Description

AbbVie’s US Commercial organization is looking for a strong analytical candidate to join a high-performing team supporting Digital Marketing for multiple businesses.  In this role, you’ll be responsible for delivering analysis, insights, and recommendations to Marketing leaders to drive increased performance and efficiency of targeted advertising touch points and new digital initiatives.  You’ll use your knowledge of digital and non-digital channels and relevant data to identify trends in performance and build a narrative around appropriate strategic and tactical adjustments.  We are looking for a highly motivated, self-driven individual that is never satisfied with the status quo and is eager to let their curiosity and can-do attitude expand the limits of bio-pharmaceutical brand delivery.  You will be expected to partner with Brand and Sales Leadership to align Marketing strategies and key priorities while supporting the current and future portfolio.  A successful candidate must be able to meaningfully communicate insights and information to a broad group of stakeholders through exceptional oral and written communication.

This is a hybrid position including days in the office, and work from home days.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Translate brand objectives into analysis design and supports opportunity assessment  through use and understanding of multiple data assets
  • Designs measurement plans, KPIs, and dashboards for campaigns  to track campaign reach and efficacy, measure use case lift and incrementality
  • Designs and implements experimental testing  against marketing channels including consulting on sample size, treatment/control selection, estimating duration to reach significance, evaluating cost/benefit, and defining success criteria.
  • Executes data measurement processes and analysis  that feed into KPIs and dashboards
  • Reports campaign impact up to Digital lead and Brand marketer  for iteration to pod and brand strategies
  • Collaborates closely with content engine and omni-channel excellence members to   iterate on campaign based on data measurement findings
  • Develops expertise across platforms and channels  to enable measurement of campaign efficacy including social, paid search and programmatic

Necessary Skills:

  • Ability to combine and interpret signals from multiple data sources with a solid understanding of various metrics leveraged by Marketing.
  • Ability to effectively communicate results of complex analytical approaches and influence action to improve brand and portfolio performance.
  • Ability to evaluate statistically modeled outputs for reliability, validity, and predictability
  • Experience with reporting/visualization (e.g., Tableau, Qlik Sense, etc.)
  • Extensive hand’s-on experience and fluency in coding SQL (BigQuery, Hue, SQL Assistant, etc.)
  • Experience with statistical testing (e.g., t-tests, ANOVA)

Qualifications

Basic:

  • Bachelor’s Degree required, with a concentration in marketing/sales/quantitative analysis preferred (degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Economics or similar preferred).
  • Experience measuring the impact of marketing tactics across at least 2 of the following: CRM, digital, web, mass media.
  • This position requires 4-6 years of relevant experience in quantitative analysis of sales and marketing information and the use of this information in the development of business plans and strategies, and 6-8 years of professional experience. It also requires strong leadership skills and a proven ability to work closely and effectively with all corporate functions and senior management.
  • Demonstrates strong project management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Must exhibit proficiency commensurate with grade in the following competencies: anticipate future needs, build collaborative partnerships, design and implement innovative solutions, demystify complex information, communicate insights and solutions and coach for greater team effectiveness.

Preferred:

  • Familiarity with clickstream and/or DMP/cookie-tracking data preferred.
  • Master’s Degree preferred.
  • Previous Pharmaceutical experience preferred.

Key AbbVie Competencies :

  • Strong communication, presentation and inter-personal skills.
  • Strong planning and organization skills.
  • Strong focus on teamwork, relationship-building and influencing others; while acting courageously, constructively, and with agility and accountability.
  • Demonstrates ability to effectively partner across multiple stakeholders (i.e. Sales Leadership, Brand Marketing, Sales Operations, Marketing Analytics, Business Insights, Finance, etc.).

Additional Information

  • The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.​

Job Description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with sales, marketing and commercial operations leadership and other key stakeholders to develop and maintain all the reporting requirements of the sales organization.
  • Automate recurring analytics reports, build data pipelines for internal clients.
  • Acquire, organize, and transform data into actionable structures.
  • Work with Data Technology team to develop and maintain backend systems and ETLs that support sales, marketing and commercial operations audience reporting and analysis.
  • Create and maintain custom web applications and dashboards using PowerBI & SFDC.
  • Analyze business operations requirements for data, evaluate existing data quality, and recommend improvement opportunities.
  • Develop, debug, and test reports across the portfolio.
  • Process unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis.
  • Analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end. Identify and define new KPIs.
  • Coordinate with internal stakeholders (Marketing, Business Technology, Incentive Compensation) to translate business requirements into actionable, systems oriented solutions.
  • Keep leadership to date on the status of issues and analyses, including known problems being worked on and perceived risks. Lead reporting initiatives across multiple business units.


Qualifications

Most possess a Bachelor’s degree foreign academic equivalent in Information Technology, Computer Science or a highly related field of study with at least 5 years of experience in:

(i)      Creating and maintaining custom web applications and dashboards using SAP BO, Microsoft Power BI, Snowflake Data Cloud, ThoughtSpot and Figma UI Design tool;

(ii)     acquire, organize, and transform data into actionable structures, identify and define new KPIs.

100% telecommuting permitted.

Pay Range: $170,692.50 - $181,500.00

Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en . Refer to Req ID: REF24414I.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Job Title: Associate Director, Training and Development US Market Access
Job Description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Director of US Market Access Learning and Development, the Associate Director of US Market Access Learning and Development (L&D), shares the responsible for: All aspects of the MA L&D Strategy, for a sub-set of the branded portfolio of products, plus all above brand a non-branded training activities required across all US Market Access Field Teams.

  • Defines L&D priorities with MAx VPs, GMs, SDs and RDs for their respective teams to include: product, competency & skill development and US market landscape training.
  • Serves as a trusted and credible advisor to the MA Field Leadership, MA Marketing Leaders, cross-functional partners, and colleagues
  • Works with AbbVie’s Commercial and Medical subject matter experts to build educational and training solutions under the 3 key pillars of Product, Marketplace, and Skills & Competencies
  • Works seamlessly with marketing and sales leadership to design and deliver engaging application training for branded, above-brand and unbranded approaches
  • Shares responsibility for Market Access training strategy formation and delivery, platform administration and training compliance documentation across a subset of the total brands (~15 brands) in the following TAs; Immunology, Eye Care, Anti-viral and Anti-infective
  • Expert in designing curriculum using adult learning principals to engage the learners and enhance the MA Field Team’s executional excellence
  • Engages with stakeholders to gain feedback on existing programs and makes the appropriate adjustments to advance the quality of the training
  • Manages and optimizes training platforms, meetings, conferences, and budgets
  • Manages, models and builds strong and credible partnerships, and networks, with AbbVie partners and industry experts. Leverages relationships to co-create industry leading educational materials. Consistently demonstrates positive AbbVie Ways of Working
  • Provides expert-driven content solutions that maintain an exceptional base of access value-chain expertise and marketplace stakeholder dynamics
  • Develops experiences that develop selling capabilities and Strategic Account Management, from financial business acumen to multi-person negotiations, and short & mid-term strategic and tactical account planning
  • Maintains superior knowledge of US market access landscape dynamics, keeping self and team up to date on current and emergent trends
  • Ensures team and/or own activities are executed compliantly and with the requisite review, approvals, oversight and documentation. Works in partnership with OEC/Legal and the materials review team to get materials reviewed and approved
  • Flexes team or own approach in anticipation of commercial strategy changes and/or marketplace changes
  • Effectively leads and partners with their direct report, the Manager, MAx L&D
  • Fosters a culture that balances collaboration, high-performance and wellbeing
  • Consistently demonstrates positive AbbVie Ways of Working

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree required. MBA, or relevant master’s degree strongly preferred
  • 5+ Years in Biopharma or Medical Device sales/or market access/or marketing/or patient services/or medical affairs/ or Training and Development role/ or MA eco-system job experience, or 7+ years in an industry-based strategic program leadership, Process Improvement, or Business/Commercial Excellence role
  • Fluency in use of Microsoft Teams meeting platform, advanced use of PowerPoint and Excel

Desirable Career Experiences :

  • Market Access experience (MA Field B2B Sales, MA Marketing, Medical Affairs (Value and Access) or a previous role supporting MA, such as MA T&D, C&P, Market Access Insights, or MA eco-system job experience)
  • Product/Sales training and/or training management experience
  • AbbVie Immunology experience. This AD and their direct report will support The Blue Team portfolio which includes our Immunology portfolio
  • Market Access Marketing or Brand Marketing Experience
  • Pharma. Sales and/or sales leadership experience (RD, NSM, DM, etc.)
  • Competency/Skill curriculum design/leadership development experience
  • Career experiences that demonstrate powerful presentation and influencing skills up and across the stakeholder continuum, gaining buy-in at various stakeholder levels, including executive leaders
  • Experience working with consulting firms and/or creative agencies in the development of training strategy and curriculum/content
  • Should have demonstrated career history of people leadership, including evidence of inspiring, developing, and motivating others
  • Should have developed and led a high-performing team and a clear preference for coaching for development in pursuit of success, with talent management experience
  • Experience in the planning of successful commercial product launch and/or business optimization strategies in Biopharma or access landscape entities, with large program project management
  • The ideal candidate would also already be familiar with AbbVie and our systems, processes, etc.

This role is based out of AbbVie’s Mettawa, IL office and requires the individual to be on-site a minimum of 3 days per work week.

Job Title: Manager, Field Marketing I/II (Area Marketing Manager - HCV) - Remote, Central/West
Job Description:
Job Description

*Can be located in the Midwest or Western States*

Purpose

This role supports assigned franchise(s) product launches and manages multiple core marketing and business processes. Responsible for analysis, planning, implementation and control of tactical programs working with agencies, third party vendors, cross functional partners and integrated brand team.

Responsibilities

  • Speaker and key opinion leader development.
  • Strategy for ad boards, consultancy, conventions, and professional alliances.
  • Training on marketing materials, development of local marketing plans and liaison between marketing and the Sales Region.
  • Responsible for developing and articulating effective marketing strategies that are impactful, executable, easily communicated, and clinically/financially supported for areas of responsibility. Demonstrates ability to segment a market, select optimal target audiences and position effectively for the target segment.
  • Manages regional consultancy, ad boards, speaker programs, meetings, and medical education projects within assigned budget. Continually evaluates and applies knowledge of the effectiveness (Return On Investment/share impact analysis) and efficiency (expense control) of tactics. Effectively manages projects to deliver high-quality work product in a timely fashion (meets deadlines). Ensures that regulatory guidelines are followed.
  • Maintains a working knowledge of industry information sources (MD/Channel level data, audits/secondary data and primary research). Uses appropriate data sources to evaluate effectiveness of promotion (Return On Investment/share impact analysis) and develop business strategy.

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Science or related field.
  • Advanced degree or previous sales/marketing experience required. MBA preferred.
  • Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards affecting Pharmaceutical Products.
  • Minimum 5 years of sales or marketing pharmaceutical experience including clinical liaison, sales training, marketing, Sr. Account Executive or District Manager experience.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Marketing Analytics and Business Insights (MABI) team supporting AbbVie’s US Commercial organization is 200+ members strong and growing every day. We comprise highly respected researchers, analysts, and strategists striving to be the gold standard Research & Analytics organization within the biopharmaceutical industry. We serve as strategic in-house advisor and pragmatic compass to Marketing, Sales, and Leadership – ensuring that all decisions are grounded in rigorous intelligence and earned intuition. We look at ‘data’ differently – as an input into insight generation, not an endgame. We appreciate ambiguity but recognize the need for clarity. We work tirelessly to build new capabilities and skill sets, encouraging our team members to pull up a chair, be themselves, be creative, speak their minds, and do good work. Patients depend on us, and we take that very seriously – without taking ourselves too seriously. We are smart, fun, quirky, and innovative – and we’d love for you to join us.

AbbVie Neuroscience encompasses Vraylar, Qulipta, and Ubrelvy as well as future brands in the AbbVie portfolio. The Associate Director, Marketing Analytics, will develop and deploy analytic solutions based on business needs across the Neuroscience Franchise to pull through brand strategy and tactics at a national and sub-national level.

This position’s primary objectives: Lead the US Neuroscience Analytics team to ensure successful execution of the analytical plan, derive findings and implications from physician and patient analytics to strengthen commercial understanding of subnational dynamics and performance, and use analytic insights to identify actionable opportunities to enhance performance.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Develop fact-based promotional investment strategies and guide investment decisions from marketing mix/business optimization and other analysis to optimize performance, influence business growth & inform the annual financial forecasting and brand planning process
  • Develop near-term KPIs and longer-term ROI measurements that will inform recommendations to optimize personal and non-personal promotional channels
  • Integrally involved with financial planning process, responsible for input into financial planning process & key conduit to Forecasting for all monthly estimates, annual plan, and long-range plan deliverables
  • Understand sub-national drivers of cross-brand performance, providing more granularity to performance dynamics across distribution channels and customers
  • Leverage innovative, sophisticated analytic models that address critical issues but also meet key business criteria (e.g., cost, risk, business impact) and key technical criteria (e.g., reliability, validity, and predictability)
  • Build, coach, and maintain a high-performing and diverse team of analytical, quantitative, and business-minded individuals that collectively extract business insights that drives better business outcomes
  • Effectively work with cross-functional partners to deliver integrated analytics reflecting the diverse contributions across the functions
  • Lead contract support, and external suppliers to increase and enhance the use of advanced modeling and analytic methods and produce results that fully leverage available data and analytics

Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree required, with a concentration in marketing/sales/quantitative analysis preferred. Advanced degree preferred.
  • 13-15 years of relevant experience in quantitative analysis of sales and marketing information is required, including use of this information in the development of business plans and strategies. Experience within the Pharma/Biotech industry is a plus. 1-2 years people leadership experience is a plus.
  • Strong analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen, and creativity in problem solving. Experience with current methods Analytics/Machine Learning.
  • Advanced experience with 3rd party pharmaceutical data sources like IQVIA/SHS Sales Data (APLD, DDD, Xponent, NSP, NPA), and Specialty pharmacy data and one or multiple analytic domains (promo optimization, digital, launch support, etc.) is a plus
    Deep hands-on expertise in current analytical methods & tools (including machine learning)
  • Advanced communication and influencing skills
  • Advanced agility, project management and prioritization skills
  • Advanced vendor management skills
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively and to influence in a matrixed organization
  • High motivation, strong work-ethic and positive attitude while working under tight timelines

Job Description:
Job Description

The Dermatology Strategic Marketing Director leads the development and execution of commercial plans to maintain market leadership in an increasingly competitive landscape.  This leader will work closely with multiple IBTs to ensure success in development of strategy, creative and execution plans, product support and sales execution. The Director is responsible for developing professional education strategy and managing medical education marketing activities for Skyrizi and RINVOQ in Dermatology.  The Director develops, implements, and maintains accountability for interactions and feedback with External Experts.  The Director works in a team-based environment to lead the development and execution of brand strategies and implementation of innovative tactics to maximize brand sales, market share, and profitability.  This leader has an enterprise mindset and can anticipate and adapt to quickly changing market priorities.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Requires the ability to provide in-depth insights based on product / market assessments, monitoring progress against brand milestones, and assimilation of key stakeholder feedback with quantitative analysis in order to make strategic recommendations for optimal brand performance
  • Identifies, builds and strengthens commercial relationships with External Experts (EEs) and emerging leaders as well as relationships with relevant patient and professional associations. Responsible for engagement with EEs and attendance at the key medical congresses to garner a better understanding of the medical condition and customer needs.
  • Responsible for providing direction to the Thought Leader Liaison (TLL) ADs and TLL team to understand customer insights to develop and optimize use of innovative marketing resources (peer to peer programming, spend allocations, speaker utilization, and programs) based on regional market dynamics.
  • Responsible for developing the advisory board strategy and leading the team on the development, content and execution of advisories throughout the year to garner a stronger understanding of the customer priorities and unmet needs.
  • Responsible for congress and convention strategy and booth execution
  • Develops and articulates high-impact medical education marketing strategies that are innovative, executable, and clinically/financially supported.  Identifies problems proactively and conceptualize solutions using creativity and innovation.
  • Responsible for competitive intelligence and competitive preparation planning, leading the cross-functional team to proactively ensure awareness and effective strategies are in place to respond to changing market dynamics.
  • Effectively tracks and manages the marketing budget. Consistently manage multiple projects to deliver high-quality work product in a timely fashion.
  • Manages team of 19, with 5 direct reports

Qualifications

Basics:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field required.  MBA preferred.
  • Previous sales/marketing experience required; 7+ years marketing experience.
  • Management experience leading cross-functional teams in a dynamitic and fast paced environment.
  • Demonstrated use of critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards affecting Pharmaceutical Products
  • Travel up to 25%

Preferred:

  • Advanced degree or previous sales/marketing experience required.
  • Experience working in multiple therapeutic categories strongly preferred

Key AbbVie Competencies:

  • Strong collaboration and team orientation, with experience accomplishing results through others and influencing others.
  • Efficient project management and communication capabilities along with strong analytical and strategic thinking skills
  • Knowledge of market trends and competitive practices.
  • Execution of Goal Plan, AbbVie Ways of Working with associated Leadership Attributes

Company Description: AbbVie discovers and delivers innovative medicines and solutions that enhance people’s lives.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Customer Service Specialist is responsible for supporting top-tier domestic customers including wholesale, largest regional, & retail accounts representing 98% of US pharma sales. Day-to-day order management utilizing the Order to Cash process to drive order deliverables to ensure on-time & complete delivery of crucial medicines to customers. Timely research & resolution for customer inquiries related to shipping, pricing discrepancies, & product returns.

This position is responsible for supporting Customer Operation functions to drive sample EDI, IDOC, and inventory reconciliation with 3PL. This role drives collaboration with business partners throughout the organization to ensure customer loyalty. This includes achievement of the company’s sales / revenue objectives measured by customer scorecards. Performance measurement must reflect the highest level of operational effectiveness & deliver exceptional customer service.

  • Ownership of high-profile customer orders and samples including order entry, order status, document creation, order release tracking through order validations, suspicious order monitoring, IDOC error resolution, shipment tracking, sales recognition, document management, and reporting for various order types: EDI, fax, email, phone, for RX, OTC, and control drugs, serialized products, and clinical trials.
  • Oversight of EDI IDOCs (monitoring and resolution).
  • Escalate correspondence between stakeholders and cross-functional teams.
  • Daily review of team open order monitoring and issue resolution.
  • Identify inventory discrepancies and follow up with internal stakeholders, 3PL, or Global Information Technology teams to get timely and accurate resolution. Track and trend inventory reconciliation issues.
  • Service to AbbVie National Wholesale Directors, Executives & OTC Leadership, AbbVie vendor’s, wholesale/retail customers, sales force, health care providers, government, hospitals, and institutions.
  • Design and generate standard/ad Hoc reports for tracking, monitoring, and analyzing data.
  • Drive AbbVie project initiatives and deliverables to timeline/budget including all sample order activities.
  • Drive Continuous Improvement:
    • Develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to ensure sample orders are processed and delivered according to customer needs.
    • Identify and initiate process improvements where applicable for superior customer service.
  • Compliance:
    • Complete/apply all quality, regulatory safety, and compliance training.
    • Fulfill audit documentation requirements for Internal Quality and external regulatory agencies for sample order activities.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree or in lieu of a degree, a minimum of 3 to 5 years of customer service-related experience, preferably in Pharmaceutical or Healthcare related industry. Working experience in SAP is preferred.
  • Proficient in key software applications, including Microsoft Office, as well as ERP, SAP preferred.
  • Knowledge of current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and regulatory pharmaceutical marketing and manufacturing principles, practices, and their application is preferred.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team, with the ability to interact with all levels of personnel, customers, and vendors in alignment with AbbVie's business processes.
  • Lead and facilitate meetings.
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to conduct root cause analysis.
  • Strategic thinking about customer experience and revenue, with decision-making authority within scope of responsibility.
  • Strong multitasking and prioritization abilities, with effective time management and organizational skills, with a high level of accuracy.

Company Description: AbbVie discovers and delivers innovative medicines and solutions that enhance people’s lives.

Job Description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for leading communication of market access insights to leadership requiring a broad range of market access expertise as the brands commonly experience differing market access challenges.
  • Lead  development of GPO, Specialty Pharmacy, Health Plan &  PBM contracting strategies for launch brands across payer channels through advanced modelling techniques, communicating analytical narratives that describe opportunity & risks of stakeholder negotiations, & informing financial projections based on launch pricing & contracting strategies.
  • Derive findings & implications from payer, physician, distributor & patient/consumer analytics to strengthen commercial understanding of marketplace dynamics, performance, & brand opportunities. Inform forecasting & brand planning processes & develop fact-based marketing & sales strategies to optimize performance.
  • Align business issues with findings & implications with some supervision.
  • Guide development of marketing investment strategies to increase  effectiveness &/or efficiency of promotional activities.
  • Influence deployment of strategy through executional recommendations across marketing & sales tactics for multiple brand &/or indications.
  • Complete timely evaluation of program impact/response & recommend appropriate actions.
  • Utilize syndicated & AbbVie proprietary data, data science & modeling techniques &  ability to synthesize insights into compelling narratives.
  • Utilize knowledge in supplier & stakeholder management, leading external analytics to deliver compelling learnings, & formulate analytical strategies appropriate to issue at hand.
  • Deliver insights based on analytics generated by leveraging multiple healthcare data sources, including physician & patient level data utilizing programs.
  • Lead delivery of brand specific market access analytical insights in response to specific market access issues/ trends. Understand impact of utilization management, tiering & medical policy impact on overall demand, line of therapy & co-pay support.
  • Conduct investigative analytics to validate &/ or quantify market phenomenon related to competitive or customer tactics. Identify value drivers that guide clinical data development & value positioning through quantitative methods.
  • Leverage custom & syndicated data sets to identify & address key business issues relative to product & indication-level performance ensuring that multiple stakeholder perspectives are considered. Integrate & synthesize information to report key insights to internal stakeholders & deep understanding of healthcare data & policies.
  • Bridge gap between new patient starts & total demand & integrate & synthesize all available information specific to issue.
  • Understand sub-national (Accounts or physicians) drivers of brand performance, providing more granularity to performance dynamics & opportunities across distribution channels & customers.
  • Create analytic models that address critical issues & meet key business criteria & key technical criteria.
  • Manage stakeholders, external partners to increase & enhance use of advanced modeling & analytic methods & produce results that fully leverage available data & analytics.
  • Develop & communicate demand forecasts in support of all brand & financial planning processes, effectively advising organization in setting financial expectations for assigned brands as well as optimizing allocation of resources to achieve the plan.
  • Effectively communicate results of complex analytical models & influence action to improve brand performance.
  • Identify & evaluate data sources that will enhance customer, market & competitive understanding, & influence budget holders to secure sources essential to driving business forward.

Qualifications

Must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Economics, Statistics or a highly related field of study with at least 5 years of related experience.

Alternatively, employer will accept a Master’s degree in aforementioned fields.

Each education alternative with at least 1 year of related experience in:

  1. informing forecasting & brand planning processes & developing fact-based marketing & sales strategies to optimize performance;
  2. delivering insights based on analytics generated by leveraging multiple data sources, including physician & patient level data utilizing programs & tools;
  3. Integrate & synthesize information to report key insights to internal stakeholders; &
  4. creating analytic models that address critical issues & meet key business criteria & key technical criteria.

Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience related to the job opportunity.  15% domestic travel required.

Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en . Refer to Req ID: REF23194H.


Additional Information

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.  This job is eligible to participate in our short-term and long-term incentive programs.

Company Description: AbbVie discovers and delivers innovative medicines and solutions that enhance people’s lives.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Associate Director, Hub Services leads cross-functional teams responsible for the BOTOX SP Hub In addition, the Associate Director will be responsible for acting as the Specialty Pharmacy Coordinator, helping to align the BOTOX reimbursement business advisors (RBAs) with all parties affecting the specialty pharmacy (SP) channel, including Trade, Market Access, National Pharmacy Sales, Business Technology Solutions (BTS), and Sales. This role reports directly to the Director Access and Reimbursement Hub Strategy and collaborates with the BOTOX RBA teams, National Field Training, Patient Services Strategy, and other key commercial stake holders.

Specific responsibilities for the Botox SP HUB include driving growth, excellence, and continuous quality improvements at hub vendor. The Associate Director must develop strategies and implement tactics to exceed the ever-changing needs of offices, patients, and specialty pharmacies. The Associate Director is responsible for a continuous partnership with the hub vendor to develop and improve: (a) hub processes; (b) customer-facing web applications and communications; (c) RBA reporting portal and communication; and (d) compliance to all legal requirements. The Associate Director also is responsible for developing resources for RBAs, training for the RBAs, and maintaining extensive communication with all RBAs and directors. Finally, the Associate Director coordinates communication and strategies between all parties affected by the SP Channel, particularly those within Patients Services, Trade, and Sales.   This individual will also be responsible for setting up the future around the use of speciality pharmacy data for the RBA teams and internal teams, including data insights around trends and in the field.

The ideal candidate has significant field reimbursement experience with both medical benefit and pharmacy benefit products, significant experience with the SP acquisition channel, solution-based initiative, demonstrated leadership ability, strong analytical, communication, and presentational skills, and a passion for improving patient access to AbbVie’s Medical Therapeutics brands within the SP Channel. Vendor management experience also preferred.

Headquarter based responsibilities

  • Manages external hub vendors to ensure that contracted SLAs are consistently met and that programs meet all regulatory, legal and compliance requirements
  • Identifies and implements opportunities to improve overall quality of hub customer deliverables.
  • Develops hub strategy by engaging customers, field input teams, and business stakeholders to identify unmet needs and create strategic solutions.  Also leverages market research and all available data to shape strategy. Establishes effective feedback mechanisms to gather regular and detailed customer and field team feedback to support continual improvement of access programs.
  • In collaboration with BTS, legal, compliance, the field input teams, and various outside vendors translates strategy into business requirements and executes on delivery of programs
  • Collaborates with the field training team to create training on how to appropriately present hub programs to customers. Also develops MRC approved marketing materials and customer communications concerning these programs
  • Responsible (in collaboration with BTS, legal and compliance) for identifying and implementing best in class analytical tools that enable the RBA team and other stakeholders to easily access Real World Data generated from various patient access programs. Partners with RBA training team to develop training on how to use insights from this data to better service customers
  • Responsible for regular and ad-hoc reporting on the impact of hub program with proactive insights and recommendations on modifications / course corrections to maximize the business value
  • Responsible for the management of all associated budgets, working proactively with all vendors and Finance team to meet forecasting timelines and budget expectations per all relevant financial procedures and guidelines

Communication and Leadership

  • Manage all forms of communication in a timely and professional manner to ensure customer needs are fully met and all relevant internal stakeholders are appropriately updated.
  • Build enduring internal, cross-functional relationships with a broad base of groups and individuals (i.e., RBA Team, BTS, sales, marketing, training, managed markets, legal, regulatory, compliance, etc.).
  • Adhere to all company guidelines, including the highest level of compliance.
  • Deliver consistent, positive leadership (without authority) to peers, management, and the various business units.
  • Contribute to the ongoing development of the department and the understanding of the business by supporting continuous learning and improvement.
  • Assume leadership of assigned and self-initiated projects.

Training and Professional Development

  • Actively participate in training and development programs, including classroom sessions and field training.
  • Pursue continuing professional education related to health care, reimbursement, and the eye care industry.
  • Establish and execute an individual developmental plan (IDP) to ensure ongoing growth and contribution.

Qualifications

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree, MPH or MBA with healthcare focus desirable
  • Health care credentialing and/or certification desirable

Experience

  • At least five (5) years or more of related experience (field reimbursement, specialty care sales, brand marketing, and/or payer account management)
  • Experience assisting HCP office staff solve complex treatment approval and reimbursement challenges
  • Experience with project management and familiarity with CRM platforms and analytical tools
  • Prior experience managing a reimbursement hub focused on medical benefit products is highly desirable.
  • Experience with co pay programs and specialty pharmacy is desirable.
  • In-depth knowledge of specialty care treatment approval and reimbursement processes (i.e., benefit verifications, prior authorizations, claim assistance, and appeals)

Essential Skills and Abilities

  • Demonstrated ability to lead impactful cross functional teams without positional authority.
  • Ability to think strategically with proven experience in planning and obtaining buy-in at all levels, including senior management.
  • Proven project management skills, detailed oriented with the ability to prioritize, and excel in a fast-paced environment.
  • High impact communications (written and verbal) across cross functional (business and technical) stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience building success metrics and customer service reporting and dashboards to manage multi-vendor services.
  • Ability to manage large operating budget across multiple vendors
  • Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision, able to identify and leverage all required resources to deliver on project goals.

​

  • The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.​

  • We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.​

  • This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. ​

  • This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs​

Company Description: AbbVie discovers and delivers innovative medicines and solutions that enhance people’s lives.

Job Description:
Job Description

Talent will be hired at a level commensurate with experience.

The Migraine Marketing Manager (MM) is a key member of the migraine marketing team and has both in-house and field responsibilities. The MM serves as the key contact for External Experts (EE), gathers business insights to support brand strategy and tactical development to drive brand performance, uncover collaboration opportunities to improve care and treatment, coordinate customer engagement activities across migraine marketing teams, external field teams, and medical stakeholders. The MM will build AbbVie’s migraine market leadership through increasing brand awareness, quality insights, and B2B collaborations to improve migraine care and treatment.

The MM will act as the face of the AbbVie Marketing team to develop and implement a coordinated customized strategy per assigned EE across all migraine brand and field facing teams. Working in an internal and external team-based environment, the MM will ensure the migraine customer engagement strategy is aligned to brand and portfolio business goals by driving and coordinating the implementation of innovative tactics.

Key Responsibilities:

External Expert Engagement and Development

  • Strengthen commercial relationships with External Experts, emerging leaders, and relevant patient and professional associations.
  • Pull through tailored engagement partnership with External Experts to improve patient care and migraine treatment within institution/practice.
  • Ensure consistent tactical execution throughout the year to drive key marketing engagement.
  • Must be able to manage effective written and oral communications with External Experts and be able to confidently represent AbbVie’s interests with key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrate in-depth understanding of external and internal drivers within key customer accounts to pull through marketing initiatives.
  • Supports development and tactical action plans; execute upon tactical plan in a timely and effective manner.
  • Leads the planning, coordination, and execution of conventions, ad boards, speaker programs, meetings, and medical education projects across marketing, access, and medical stakeholders within assigned budget.
  • Understand objectives and key business insights for advisory meetings, identify and recruit appropriate HCP targets for participation, attend and/or assist in ad board facilitation.
  • Provide training on HCP led peer to peer slide deck content and updates and uncover area speaker programming opportunities based on local market dynamics, provide guidance on speaker selection and content to align speaker to audience.

Marketing Initiatives

  • Lead projects compliantly and effectively through the promotional review process to deliver high-quality work in a timely fashion (meets deadlines).  Ensures that regulatory guidelines and AbbVie processes are followed.
  • Requires the ability to synthesize in-depth insights based on brand key business questions that will provide input to marketing brand teams, resource optimization, and tactic development to drive brand performance.
  • Responsible for understanding market drivers, competitive landscape, and provider dynamics.
  • Effectively track and manage the marketing budget. Consistently manage multiple projects to deliver high-quality work products in a timely fashion.
  • Coordinate the work of multiple external vendors and internal departments including Agency Partners, Marketing, Market Research, Legal, Regulatory, Medical Affairs, Corporate Compliance, Consumer Marketing, and IT

Scope and Key Skills

  • Strong communication (verbal and non-verbal) skills.
  • Understanding of marketing and sales organizations collaboration to drive brand performance.
  • Maintains a working knowledge of industry information sources (MD/Channel level data, audits/secondary and primary research).  Uses appropriate data sources to evaluate effectiveness of promotional tactics and develop business strategy.
  • Strong collaboration and team orientation, with experience accomplishing results by influencing without authority.
  • Self-development with the latest clinical data, brand strategy and tactics, competitive landscape, and ability to develop standard tools.
  • Ability to work and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to effectively plan, prioritize, execute, follow up, anticipate problems, and find solutions.
  • Strategic thinker with autonomy to forge focused business strategies with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Good relationship skills with the ability to self-organize and work across multiple functions (sales, compliance, finance, product development, public affairs, medical affairs), with the ability to influence.
  • Continually evaluates and applies knowledge of the effectiveness and efficiency of key tactics to meet measurable key performance indicators.
  • Effectively manages projects to deliver high-quality work in a timely fashion (meets deadlines).
  • Strong digital mindset, capabilities, and confidence towards omnichannel usage
  • Ensure regulatory guidelines are followed.
  • Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards affecting Pharmaceutical Products (e.g. CFR 210/211, cGMP) specifically, significant health care experience. Understanding of attributes of other functional areas and impact of relevant decisions

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Previous experience in sales, sales management, or marketing with at least 2 years of experience in Migraine (preferred).
  • Travel up to 60% of the time including some weekends, with requirement for evening work.
  • Collaborative working style.  Must work across an integrated team colleague, understanding priorities and key responsibilities that impact the business.

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: ​

​

  • The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.​

  • We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.​

  • This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. ​

  • This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs. ​

​

  • Leads the planning, coordination, and execution of conventions, ad boards, speaker programs, meetings, and medical education projects across marketing, access, and medical stakeholders within assigned budget.
  • Understand objectives and key business insights for advisory meetings, identify and recruit appropriate HCP targets for participation, attend and/or assist in ad board facilitation.
  • Provide training on HCP led peer to peer slide deck content and updates and uncover area speaker programming opportunities based on local market dynamics, provide guidance on speaker selection and content to align speaker to audience.

Marketing Initiatives

  • Lead projects compliantly and effectively through the promotional review process to deliver high-quality work in a timely fashion (meets deadlines).  Ensures that regulatory guidelines and AbbVie processes are followed.
  • Requires the ability to synthesize in-depth insights based on brand key business questions that will provide input to marketing brand teams, resource optimization, and tactic development to drive brand performance.
  • Responsible for understanding market drivers, competitive landscape, and provider dynamics.
  • Effectively track and manage the marketing budget. Consistently manage multiple projects to deliver high-quality work products in a timely fashion.
  • Coordinate the work of multiple external vendors and internal departments including Agency Partners, Marketing, Market Research, Legal, Regulatory, Medical Affairs, Corporate Compliance, Consumer Marketing, and IT

Scope and Key Skills

  • Strong communication (verbal and non-verbal) skills.
  • Understanding of marketing and sales organizations collaboration to drive brand performance.
  • Maintains a working knowledge of industry information sources (MD/Channel level data, audits/secondary and primary research).  Uses appropriate data sources to evaluate effectiveness of promotional tactics and develop business strategy.
  • Strong collaboration and team orientation, with experience accomplishing results by influencing without authority.
  • Self-development with the latest clinical data, brand strategy and tactics, competitive landscape, and ability to develop standard tools.
  • Ability to work and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to effectively plan, prioritize, execute, follow up, anticipate problems, and find solutions.
  • Strategic thinker with autonomy to forge focused business strategies with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Good relationship skills with the ability to self-organize and work across multiple functions (sales, compliance, finance, product development, public affairs, medical affairs), with the ability to influence.
  • Continually evaluates and applies knowledge of the effectiveness and efficiency of key tactics to meet measurable key performance indicators.
  • Effectively manages projects to deliver high-quality work in a timely fashion (meets deadlines).
  • Strong digital mindset, capabilities, and confidence towards omnichannel usage
  • Ensure regulatory guidelines are followed.
  • Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards affecting Pharmaceutical Products (e.g. CFR 210/211, cGMP) specifically, significant health care experience. Understanding of attributes of other functional areas and impact of relevant decisions

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Previous experience in sales, sales management, or marketing with at least 2 years of experience in Migraine (preferred).
  • Travel up to 60% of the time including some weekends, with requirement for evening work.
  • Collaborative working style.  Must work across an integrated team colleague, understanding priorities and key responsibilities that impact the business.

Job Title: Associate Director, Commercial Data Operations - Acquisitions
Job Description:
Job Description

The Marketing Analytics and Business Insights (MABI) function supports AbbVie’s US organization and is comprised of highly respected researchers, analysts, data scientists and strategists who are committed to being best-in-class within the biopharmaceutical industry.  We serve as a strategic in-house counsel, ensuring that all decisions leverage the key insights that we develop.  We continue to build new capabilities and skill sets, encouraging our team members to pull up a chair, be themselves, be creative, speak their minds, and do good work.  We are a passionate, diverse, flexible, and inclusive organization with a culture that supports the best ideas, wherever they originate.  We are smart, fun, quirky, and innovative – and we’d love for you to join us.

As the Associate Director of Commercial Data Operations, you will be responsible for overseeing data acquisition, integration, delivery, and utilization across US Therapeutic Operations. You will develop and execute strategies for maximizing AbbVie’s investments in syndicated aggregated prescription and patient claims data from purchase (contracts) through transformation to the consumption layer.

This role offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to ensure commercial data acquisition supports the data needs of various business units and drives business value. Specifically, this role will support Brand Analytics, Sales Operations, Market Access, and Patient Services teams. If you are a data-driven leader with a passion for patient-centricity and experience managing healthcare data, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Acquisition and Integration:
    • Develop effective strategies for acquiring Claims and Rx data from syndicated and specialty networks, ensuring diverse sources are utilized.
    • Manage vendor data contracts, budgets, and vendor relationships to ensure quality, compliance, and cost-effectiveness.
    • Define an effective data acquisition strategy through understanding of user needs, therapeutic area dynamics, and vendor data coverage and quality capabilities
    • Collaborate with stakeholders regularly to assess and acquire data based on their specific requirements, proactively addressing anomalies in data quality and supplier dynamics.
    • Work collaboratively with data stewards and IT teams to establish business rules and data quality standards for integrating commercial data.
    • Monitor and oversee data pipelines to ensure accurate and efficient ingestion, cleansing, and transformation of data, ensuring data quality standards are met.
    • Provide ownership of commercial data domains, being accountable for the quality, availability, and usability of Rx data, and resolve data issues promptly.
    • Manage both internal AbbVie resources and external offshore resources to successfully achieve business objectives and ensure smooth operations.
  • Data Delivery and Utilization:
    • Oversee the integration of Rx and Claims data from multiple vendors ensuring the anonymization of the data and data quality is maintained throughout the integration process.
    • Deliver consistent, trustworthy syndicated and specialty Rx and claims data to internal stakeholders across commercial functions.
    • Develop and implement data access governance policies and procedures.
    • Define and implement data quality rules and cleansing procedures.
    • Collaborate with stakeholders to define data needs and translate them into actionable data delivery formats and reports.
  • Commercial Analytics and Operations Support:
    • Collaborate closely with sales operations teams to support sales force incentive compensation quota modeling and sales crediting.
    • Analyze trends and anomalies in external data, proactively  data quality issues and coverage gaps to provide support for various business units
  • Technology and Systems:
    • Partner with IT teams to design, build, and manage secure and efficient data acquisition and reporting pipelines for commercial functions.
    • Stay up-to-date on data management technologies and trends, recommending solutions to improve data quality and accessibility.
    • Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations (e.g., HIPAA, CCPA).
  • Stakeholder Management:
    • Collaborate effectively with data owners, business system owners, platform owners, data operations teams, and other key stakeholders across the organization.
    • Effectively lead organizational change that improves data quality
    • Communicate commercial data operations challenges to stakeholders.

Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor's degree in related field, such as Information Systems.
  • Minimum 10 years of professional experience with at least 5 years in data operations.
  • Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering high-quality data for patient-centric initiatives.
  • Deep understanding of commercial data sources and data needs within pharma (e.g., IQVIA, Symphony Health).
  • Strong analytical and data visualization skills.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage and motivate cross-functional teams.
  • Leadership experience and proven ability to drive improvements in commercial analytics and operations through data utilization.
  • Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations (e.g., HIPAA, CCPA).

Preferred:

  • Experience with data management tools and platforms (e.g., data warehouses, ETL tools).
  • Experience with healthcare data systems and platforms.
  • Experience working within a regulated environment.
  • Experience with managing Patient services programs
  • Project management skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

This range may be modified in the future.​

Job Title: Director, HCP Promotion Lead, aMDD Indication - Psychiatry Marketing
Job Description:
Job Description

About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at  www.abbvie.com . Follow @abbvie on  Twitter,  Facebook,  Instagram,  YouTube  and  LinkedIn .

Director, HCP Promotion Lead, aMDD Indication

The Director, HCP Promotion Lead, is responsible for all HCP-facing promotion for the aMDD indication, which is coming off a highly successful launch for a large psychiatry product.   Primary responsibilities include driving strategic direction for the indication, along with the pull through execution is tracking efforts that support this high opportunity indication.    Additionally, this candidate will lead a team and be responsible for the career development for 3-4 direct reports.

Reporting to the HCP Head of Marketing, the HCP Promotion Lead for aMDD will also partner closely with the Integrated Brand Team (IBT), Media Team, and Digital Lab to drive both planning and execution.   Most importantly, this candidate will partner closely with the HCP BPI lead to drive growth for the overall brand.   Externally, the HCP Promotions Lead for aMDD will work with creative agency partners to deliver best-in-class HCP campaigns, messaging, tactics, and programs.

Key Job Responsibilities:


  • Lead delivery of best-in-class messaging, tactics, and marketing programs for evolution of aMDD indication one year post launch

  • Co-Lead strategic brand initiatives including HCP segmentation, Masterbrand, and Evolution of Brand Story

  • Design and shape HCP media strategy, and digital tactic tracking/optimization in partnership with the Media Team, MABI, and Digital Lab

  • Management of multiple agencies to lead creation of aMDD HCP brand tactical and strategic plans, partner in creation of the overall brand strategic and tactical plans

  • Participate in sales team updates, meetings, and field activities to ensure the voice of our largest investment is heard and pulled through in all resource developed.

  • Develop compelling presentations to convey strategies to broad sets of stakeholder audiences, including senior executives, cross-functional leadership teams, and cross-functional partners for understanding and support of brand plans

  • Create and enable career development and skill growth plans for up to 3-4 direct reports

Significant Work Activities -Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day)


Qualifications


  • BA/BS required; MBA strongly preferred

  • 7-10 years of sales and marketing experience, with a minimum of 5 years of HCP promotion experience, including sales team engagement and agency.

  • Significant experience in the pharmaceutical, medical device, or biotechnology industries with a successful track record of ascending responsibility

  • Demonstrates the ability to communicate ideas & make the complex easy for others to understand.

  • Builds strong relationships with peers and cross functional partners outside of immediate team.

  • Executes highly effective working team meetings with internal and external partners and is visibly inclusive and transparent.

  • Works collaboratively and proactively, maintains high degree of planning, coordination & project management skills, demonstrated ability to problem solve & resolve conflict with diplomacy.

  • Strong analytical and strategic marketing skills

  • Scientific acumen & therapeutic understanding, with the ability to extract insights from the analysis of complex datasets.

  • Experience with launch &/or on-market commercial teams an advantage.

  • Experience working within matrix-based teams and project management.

  • Self-starter, learns fast, quickly grasps the essence of concepts, can change course rapidly where required, demonstrates intellectual curiosity.

  • Open to suggestion & experimentation for improvement, embraces ideas from others, encourages innovation but matches innovation to reality.

  • Exhibits strong emotional intelligence, diplomacy, maintenance of confidentiality, maturity, and organizational savvy.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Manager of Access & Fulfillment Analytics will be a key contributor to the team responsible for access and fulfillment analytics. This individual is skilled in designing and conducting analytics to assess both the operational execution and impact of access and fulfillment resources within Abbvie Patient Services.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute the analytical plan for various components within the Patient Access & In-Field Access & Reimbursement teams.
  • Proactively identify changing business dynamics relevant to the Patient Services programs related to hub services, insurance support and prior authorization
  • Engage with senior leaders in the Patient Services organization to measure and drive improvements in existing programs and services supporting access and fulfilment.
  • Define and co-create analytical use cases and KPI tracking to ensure patient support programs are meeting the brand business objectives for optimal support of patients and health care professionals.
  • Identify and address key business issues relative to program execution and performance ensuring that multiple partners / stakeholder perspectives are considered; Integrate and synthesize all available information specific to the issue.
  • Leverage innovative, sophisticated analytic models that address critical issues but also meet key business criteria (e.g. cost, risk, business impact) and key technical criteria (e.g. reliability, validity, and predictability)
  • Lead an analytic team of contractors and external suppliers to increase and enhance the use of advanced modeling and analytic methods and produce results that fully leverage available data and analytics.
  • Establish, Manage, and continuously improve various levels of reporting for program / contract evaluations as well as executive communication

**Can hire a candidate at Grade 18 or 19. Talent will be hired at a level commensurate with experience.**


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree (Business Administration, Statistics, Economics) required, with a concentration in marketing/sales/quantitative analysis.  Master’s Degree a plus.
  • 7+ years of experience in quantitative analysis of sales and marketing data; including use of this information in the development of business plans and strategies.
  • People management experience preferred.
  • Experience with programming languages used in analytics (R, Python, SAS, or SPSS) and related statistical modules highly desired.
  • BI tool (Qlik/Tableau/Power BI) and DB query language (SQL/HIVE/IMPALA) knowledge preferred.
  • Strong understanding and prior experience with the development and implementation in one or more of the following: Co-Pay, HUB processes, Pharmacy workflow, Field Access Specialists and/or specialty pharmacy.
  • Knowledge and understanding of pharma ecosystem and datasets including physician-level prescribing, institutional sales data, payer-prescriber-level data, formulary data, Rebates, Symphony claims, Copay claims.
  • Strong leadership skills and a proven ability to collaborate effectively with all corporate functions and senior management.
  • Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen, and creativity in problem solving.
  • Command of the following software programs (PowerPoint, Excel, Access).
  • Demonstrated project management skills.
